query.queryString: (/article/relations/categories/collection/code='resultsPack,projectsInfoPack,brief' OR (/result/relations/categories/collection/code='deliverable,publication' OR contenttype='project')) AND ('SUSTAINABILITY' OR 'INNOVATION' OR 'MULTI-CRITERIA')

warnings.message: One of the fields on which a sort was requested does not exist

result.title: Public and internal websites, corporate design, publication and deliverable templates
result.description: The project will set up a public website (the domains have already been reserved: www.inception-project.eu and www.inception-project.org). The public website will act as a communication and dissemination channel for the project’s results and for involving and enlarging the stakeholders’ community. It will serve as the main interface towards the stakeholders who are interested in the work and achievements of the project. It will be connected with the INCEPTION Semantic Web platform though user-friendly access. Next to the public website, an internal project website (SharePoint) for information sharing among consortium partners will be set-up. Access to the SharePoint project website will be possible both through web-enabled portal as well as mobile devices (iPad App). SharePlus Office Mobile Client app (available in App Store for free for the lite version), is an easy to use office app On the Go for retrieving and editing SharePoint documents on mobile devices. This can be easily done with or without network connectivity and will sync the changes securely when back at the office. If a file was changed by someone else while out of the office, the app will detect the collision and ask what version to keep. Corporate design style of the INCEPTION project will be produce for all kinds of documents and publications that would come out of the work on the project.

result.description: This deliverable is a result from Tasks 5.2, 5.3, 5.4, 5.5, 5.6 and 5.7. result.title: Programme of users and technical requirements and common parameters for European cultural assets
result.description: This is a result from T1.2, and it is a report regarding main technical requirements for Cultural Heritage data capturing and data handling and management. The a report is a guide to the user and a feedback for supplier of metric survey data. It examines issues such as quality, accuracy, time, costs and specific skills required. The report will also establish common parameters of European cultural assets.

result.title: Establishment of stakeholder panel, value-added assessment and State of the Art
result.description: This is a result from T1.1, and it establish the broad stakeholder panel regards to country, type and discipline. After the panel establishment (M6), a value assessment report addressing the stakeholder’s requirements on cultural heritage for different type of end users will be delivered. An overall State-of-the-Art will be accomplished.

result.title: Mapping backsliding and reflections on workshop
result.description: The deliverable will address the research on how and to what extent the crisis and the response it draws from national leaders exacerbates democratic and/or acquis backsliding. It will also include reflections on the workshop [month 14] on ‘backsliding’ in terms of corruption control, human rights, equality and social justice in the EU.

result.title: E-module
result.description: The deliverable will include the production of an ‘e-module’ that will offer key recommendations and insights from the project for political leaders in EU and national institutions. This will take the form of an on-line question-and answer video that can be used for teaching purposes.
